value: Designs for Ewers, from Dessins d'orfèvrerie (Designs for Metalwork)

label: Description
value: Fontainebleau school. Design for two ewers. On the left ewer, the Birth of Venus. On the right one, the Triumph of Neptune. Both are decorated with pearls, jewels and strapwork, crabs, frogs, lobsters, putti and grotesque masks.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Portrait of Hugues Brisville, from Diverses pièces de serruriers (Various Designs for Locksmiths)

label: Description
value: Self-portrait of Hugues Brisville set within an oval medallion enclosed by an ornamental frame composed of grotesques with masks and the heads of various animals; putti and the figures of Time and Minerva terminating in foliate scrolls. Brisville is depicted seated at a table by an open window with a piece of paper and holding a chalk holder and compass in his right hand, a view of a balcony, garden and wrought iron gates beyond. A frame of grotesques with acanthus rinceaux, bird heads, masks, and dogs. At the bottom, two figures with bodies terminating in acanthus leaves, representing Time and Minerva. The left figure, an older man, holds a scroll with a cipher, assisted by a winged child. The right figure wears antique style armor and holds a shield with a coat-of-arms, assisted by the half figure of a putto. At bottom center, an hourglass and owl perched on a flower. At center, the portrait of a man with long hair, seated at a ledge with paper and pen before him. Surrounding him are four winged figures; the one at top left holds a page and draughtman’s tools.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving and etching on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Design for the Ceiling of the Salon of the Palazzo Spinola, Genoa

label: Description
value: An oval central panel shows the Apotheosis of Amrbose Spinola, being borne to heaven on a chariot. The outer edge of the ceiling is composed of segmented panels with vine tendril arabesques and putti. Columnar and pier supports are indicated at the outer edges.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Physical description
value: Etching Support: white laid paper tipped into beige paper

label: Dimensions
value: 16.8 x 12.1 cm (6 5/8 x 4 3/4 in.) Platemark/repeat:  15.3 x 10.8 cm (6 x 4 1/4 in.) Mat:  45.7 x 35.6 cm (18 x 14 in.)

Plate 1, Title Plate, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: At center, a cartouche surrounded by putti at left and right, each holding the support of a banner at top. Above the escutcheon, a crown of laurel leaves.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 3, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 3, plate 3 of a series of 12. Folio 2, plate 2 of a series of 12. Design for a vase or perfume burner to be executed in metal with curving fluted forms, placed on a pedestal. Two climbing figures of putti decorate the lid. At the sides, busts of winged female figures. At the front, a shell-like form. Smoke clouds in the background. At the base of the vase, leafy branches.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 4, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 4, plate 4 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving forms, placed on a pedestal. A shell-shaped lid is attached to the left handle by a chain, the handles composed of two rams’ heads decorated with snakes.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 8, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 8, plate 8 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. On the body, a scene of four nude women. The handle at left is composed of a feathered bird stretched across the body of the vase, its neck forming the handle curve and its beak prying open the lid at top. The right handle a sharper geometric form resting upon a mask. Leafy garland draped from the right handle to the pedestal. Garden wall indicated in background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Suite of 7 Ornamental Designs with the Judgement of Paris

label: Description
value: Series of 6 figures from the episode of the Judgement of Paris. The three contestants for Paris’ apple, Juno, Minerva and Venus, are each accompanied by an identifying attribute. Also included in the series are paris, Mercury and a river god. Two prints of the latter are included. Figures are set within a medallion on a dark field (sur fond noir) decorated with intricate grotesques, sometimes relating to the central figure.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
